extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 butternut squash, quartered and seeded, each quarter halved

extendedIngredients.name: cajun seasoning
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Tbs. plus 8 tsp. Cajun seasoning, or more to taste, divided

extendedIngredients.name: celery ribs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 large celery ribs, sliced on the bias (2 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup plus 1 Tbs. olive oil, divided

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 large onions, halved and sliced (8 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: red bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 medium red or green bell peppers, quartered and sliced (2 cups)

recipes.title: Smothered Cajun-Spiced Squash
recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine 1 Tbs. oil and garlic in small bowl. Brush garlic-oil mixture over butternut squash pieces, and place on baking sheet. Sprinkle each squash piece with ½ tsp. Cajun seasoning, and season with salt and pepper, if desired. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until squash pieces are tender enough to easily pierce with fork.2. Meanwhile, heat remaining ¼ cup oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onions, bell peppers, and celery, and cook 20 to 25 minutes, or until vegetables are soft and beginning to brown, stirring occasionally.3. Stir flour into onion mixture, and cook 1 minute, or until flour begins to brown, stirring constantly. Stir in vinegar, remaining 2 Tbs. Cajun seasoning, and 6 cups water. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer 20 minutes, or until sauce has thickened, stirring occasionally.4. To serve: Place 2 squash pieces on plate. “Smother” with 1 cup onion mixture.

steps.step: Combine 1 Tbs. oil and garlic in small bowl.

Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until squash pieces are tender enough to easily pierce with fork.2. Meanwhile, heat remaining ¼ cup oil in large skillet over medium heat.
